intro: Guettarda pichisensis, commonly known as the Pichis guettarda, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen nature, with glossy, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely on the stems. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
